maqras.text: Glory to the name of your Lord Most High
Who has created, and further gives order and proportion
Who has ordained laws, and granted guidance
And Who makes the pasture grow
And then makes it dark stubble
By degrees We will teach you to declare the message, so you will not forget
Except what God wills, for He knows what is manifest and what is hidden
And We will ease you to what is easy
Therefore give advice, in case the advice profits
The advice will be received by those who are conscious of God
But it will be avoided by the most unfortunate ones
Who will enter the great fire
In which they will then neither die nor live
But those will flourish who refine themselves
And glorify the name of their Lord in prayer
No, you prefer the life of the present
But the hereafter is better and longer lasting
And this is in the Ancient Books
The Books of Abraham and Moses
Has the story reached you of the overwhelming event
Some faces that day will be humiliated
Laboring hard
While they are entering the blazing fire
While they are given drink, from a boiling hot spring
No food will there be for them but a bitter Dhari’
That will neither nourish nor satisfy hunger
Faces that day will be joyful
Pleased with their striving
In a garden on high
Where they will hear no vanity
There will be a bubbling spring
There will be thrones raised on high
Goblets placed
And cushions set in rows
And rich carpets spread out
Do they not look at the camels, how they are made
And at the sky, how it is raised high
And at the mountains, how they are firmly fixed
And at the earth, how it is spread out
Therefore give advice, for you are one to advise
You are not one to manage their affairs
But if any turn away and reject God
God will punish him with a mighty punishment
To Us will be their return
Then it will be for Us to call them to account
By the dawn
By the ten nights
By the even and odd
And by the night when it passes away
Is there not in these an oath for those who understand
Do you not see how your Lord dealt with the ‘Ad
Of Iram, with lofty pillars
The like of which were not produced in all the land
And with the Thamud, who carved out rocks in the valley
And with Pharaoh, lord of stakes
All of these transgressed beyond bounds in the lands
And spread corruption therein
Therefore your Lord poured on them a scourge of diverse chastisements
For your Lord is on a watchtower
Now, as for humanity, when their Lord tries them, giving them honor and gifts, they then say, “My Lord has honored me.”
But when He tries them, restricting subsistence from them, he says then, “My Lord has humiliated me.”
But no, you do not honor the orphans
Nor do you encourage one another to feed the poor
And you devour inheritance, all with greed
And you love wealth with inordinate love
No, when the earth is pounded to powder
And your Lord comes, and His angels, rank upon rank
And hell, that day, is brought forth, on that day will the human being remember, but how will that remembrance profit him
He will say, “I wish that I had invested in my life.”
For that day, their chastisement will be such as none else can inflict
And His bonds will be such as none other can bind
To the righteous soul it will be said, “O you soul in complete rest and satisfaction
“Come back to your Lord, well pleased, and well-pleasing
“Enter then among My devotees
“Yes, enter My paradise
